reviewText:
After 1st update: Camera is a bit better than it's launch, but it's still bad nonetheless. Zooming in helped make I Will Escape a bit better, but being zoomed out and going through a door sideways gives problems to the camera. Also, first person view isn't that well recieved either. You either have to hold the mouse buttons for that view or try to scroll around and click left mouse until you get it. AI has gotten a little better, but it's still bad. They still have that component of idiocy where they stand there and look around and leave (only this time it's longer). A guard caught me hiding next to a wall even though he was looking at the right of my perspective, which still shows that they're incomplete. There's still no option to change controls, so that's a big NO devs. Also, good thing that there's a tutorial now since people playing this game got confused trying to figure out how the controls work. This game is still not above mediocre. I could accept the fact that the graphics don't matter to any game, but suprisingly, the update gave me lower FPS than before. That might not be the problem for others, but for me, it is obviously.

Before update:

-terrible graphics
-terrible AI
-terrible animations
-terrible stealth" system
-terrible camera
-terrible controls that you can't even bind

Overall: I thought this game could pull off some good features
date: but boy was I wrong. The game is downright a disappointment. This game looked like a mod for source games. It doesn't even give you a tutorial on the start. Instead
recommended: you have to pick up pictures that give you a "tutorial"
hoursPlayed: and it doesn't even tell how how to pick it up until you find one of the pictures for it. The worst part is that you're stuck with the controls for the rest of the game because it won't let you bind keys. The AI is downright terrible. I opened a door
voteText: and the gaurd went to investigate by walking towards the door and saying some random dialogue as he just walks away. The "stealth" in this game plays out as trial and error since getting caught once is an instant failure. The protagonist walks (or runs) like a woman. When you jump off and die
helpfulPercent: the death animation looks like it was from an N64 game. The camera is way too far away from the protagonist
votesHelpful: and when you use the mouse
votesTotal: it just zooms in near your shoulder to the point where you can see through his arms and shoulder. This game's mechanics feels incomplete
votesFunny: and I feel like I've been ripped off. This game could've been good
commentsCount: but it's execution is too terrible."
column19: 226 of 262 people (86%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is mediocre at best, there are so many things that just make this unenjoyable to me.
Firstly the A.I in the game is dumb as a brick.
They cannot notice you while you run under and near them in the same room for an example.
This makes the first  selling point of the game, the stealth aspect, pointless as there is no real sense of danger.

The second selling point according to the store page, is climbing the prison walls and such like in assasins creed or something. Even that is botched up on the very fist time you need to that.

The unresponsive controls (at least on the keyboard, don't know about controller) certainly doesn't help it. Just to open the inventory I had to bash the i" button several times to get it open.

The story also is quite non existent and you get no connection to the silent protagonist at all.

If you want to see some footage of the game you can check my video of it      here

Don't buy this. The Steam sale is on and a lot of better games are available for far less of you'r hard earned dollars/euros/quids."

reviewText: I dont know how far I got through the game towards the end, but it was a fairly decent game. I played it for about 2.3 hours  and it finally destroyed my computer. I went to go open a cabinet in game and it completely crashed. The part that I played though, I quite enjoyed very much. I recorded it on my youtube channel and I could tell it wasnt ready for youtube yet knowing that I just bought it in the early stages of development. Overall though, excellent and challenging game :). https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLpu2OT14iHlOrwQV92bcPgfNdeTdOoL7L

reviewText:
I just played this game for a few hours an must say that I'm quite impressed.
I like the way the game lets figure things out for yourself, it reminds me of those hard games from the past where you get way more excited to advance through the game than most modern day games.

The game gets more interesting after you've played throught te first levels, you get more information about who you are and why you are escaping.

It's not perfect, the animations could be better and the camera sometimes gets in the way but I do look forward to continue playing. Surely this game also shows what the Blender game engine is capable of.
